Articles.Content:
1. I Open KSP 1.1 and fly an existing ship from the tracking

2. I go back to the space center 

3. I enter the tracking station

4. I am unable to select or fly any ships. I am unable to leave the tracking station. I am still able to manipulate the camera but that's it. The tracking station is locked up and I cant do anything. I must force close KSP each time I want to access the tracking station a second time.

5. There is only ONE object in the "tracked object" window called "Space Station One". There is nothing else in tracked objects and I can assure that all items are enabled. 

6. After restarting KSP I search among all the object out there in the tracked objects window and I do not see any object labeled "Space Station One"

Link to log file (how do I attach my log file properly?): https://onedrive.live.com/redir?resid=902BE10C38C616F5!84911&authkey=!ACTp9TbzopzsBrk&ithint=file%2ctxt

INSTALLED MODS:

KSP: 1.1 (Win64) - Unity: 5.2.4f1 - OS: Windows 10  (10.0.0) 64bit
USI Tools - 0.5.3
Behemoth Aerospace Engineering Large Parts - 1.2.3
CIT - CIT_Util - 1.2.1
CIT - ActiveStruts - 1.1.1
Community Resource Pack - 0.4.5
DMagic Orbital Science - 1.2.3
Infernal Robots - 2.0
Infernal Robots - 2.0
HyperEdit - 1.5
KSP-AVC Plugin - 1.1.6.1
Modular Rocket Systems - 1.12.6
NavHud - 1.3
Docking Port Alignment Indicator - 6.2
PlanetShine - 0.2.5
RCS Sounds - 5.0
RemoteTech - 1.6.9
SCANsat - 1.1.2
SpaceY Lifters - 1.12.2
TAC Fuel Balancer - 2.5.1.7
TAC Life Support - 0.11.2.1
TweakScale - 2.2.7.2
USI Exploration Pack - 0.4.1
Freight Transport Tech - 0.4.2
Karbonite - 0.6.2
Karbonite Plus - 0.4
MKS - 0.30.3
Sounding Rockets - 0.2

Edited April 29, 2016 by Voodoo8648

Could this phantom debris labeled "Space Station One" be the problem? When I initially go into the tracking station, I cannot find this debris. But after I go BACK into the locked up tracking station, this object is the ONLY object in the list, but i don't see it on the map

I'm also having the same problem with KSP 1.1.1 on Windows 10 (64bit). I've looked over your list of mods and the ones we have in common are these:

DMagic Orbital Science - 1.2.3

Docking Port Alignment Indicator - 6.3

RemoteTech - 1.6.11

TAC Life Support - 0.11.2.1

Note that I have newer versions of Docking Port Alignment Indicator and RemoteTech. Also, I'm using the hacked version of TAC Life Support, are you also using the hacked version?

I'm guessing it's either RT or TAC that's causing the problem as both of these mods add things to the Tracking station. I'll remove these mods separately and report back what I find.

2 minutes ago, WalterB said:

Awesome brother, thanks WalterB

I found this after digging down a few pages:

It's definitely an issue with RT and has been fixed in the dev build.

I actually upgraded RT after I posted this thread and I played with KSP for a while after I got home and it seems to be running well now. No issues with the tracking station. I would say you're totally right about RT. Thank you soo much for looking into this!
Got the same problem every now and then. Tought i'll mention it since i'm using RT but not TACls. That might help you narrow it down.

Ok to burst a few bubbles now. I am having the save problems and am NOT using Remote Tech OR TACLS. The only Mods that I have and match the OP's list are following:

USI Exploration & tools, SCANsat, Tweakscale, Karbonte & Plus, Dmagic Orbital Science, Community Resource Pack

So actually this gives me the impression that this a totally different problem all together which may effect a lot of mods. Or is a Squad bug which turns up when certain mods are used. But judging that Walther B Also had problems and compared to my install I see only 1 name that is the same as his: Dmagic !! This may well be a/the problem!

I can confirm the issue on my install, bloody Space Station One, and it's not exclusive to 64 bit (accidentally opened 32 bit a couple times).

I have SCANSat, RemoteTech, KER, WaypointManager, KAlarmClock, and of course KSP-AVC. Those are quite literally the ONLY mods I'm using. I think Mad Wulfus may have hit the nail on the head though, there may be a bug in 1.1.x that is affecting specific mod types. The most commonalities seem to be in SCANsat and RT, maybe something they are both touching?

Ok, the problem is BACK! The game seemed to have been operating fine for a few sessions, but now the Tracking Station keeps locking up again, and "Space Station One" keeps appearing in the "tracked objects" panel.

Im using RT 1.6.9 (according to Add-on Version Checker this is for 1.0.5)

Scan Sat 1.1.6 (according to Add-on Version Checker this is for 1.1.x)
I'm having this issue as well with all of my flights, but I do not use remote tech. I do use scansat

45 minutes ago, TonyMacaroni said:

I'm having this issue as well with all of my flights, but I do not use remote tech. I do use scansat

Interesting. I'll have to see if the problem persist after removing scansat

Edited May 1, 2016 by Psycho_zs

I am also having this problem.  Chatterer, CommunityResourcePack, CrossFeedEnabler, DMagic Orbital Science, ForScience, FuelWings, InterstellarFuelSwitch, KAS, KAX, KerbodynePlus, KerboKatz, KIS, KSP-AVC, MagicSmokeIndustries, Mk2Expansion, ModRocketSys-Lite, MouseAimFlight, PlanetShine, RCSSounds, RealPlume, RemoteTech, SCANSat, Scatterer, Smokescreen, Space-Y, StageRecovery, TextureReplacer, KerbalAlarmClock, TweakableEverything, TweakScale, VOID.

I also have this issue.

Only thing I can do is Force close the program.

Mods are: Remote tech, SCANsat, Tweakables, KER, KAC, AVC,  - all checked up to date via CKAN.

4 hours ago, Callmedave said:

I also have this issue.

Only thing I can do is Force close the program.

Mods are: Remote tech, SCANsat, Tweakables, KER, KAC, AVC,  - all checked up to date via CKAN.

CKAN does not have the latest dev build of RemoteTech which fixes this issue.  You have to download and install it manually from github

https://github.com/RemoteTechnologiesGroup/RemoteTech/releases

I have a similar issue when I remove / delete debris via the tracking station.  I can deleted the debris, go back to KSC, but when I go back to the tracking.  All off icons [debris, probes, landers, etc.] are all 99 , but there isn't anything visible and I can't exit the tracking station.

If I check my persist file and the file since is around 5 mb,  then I know that I can restart the game and usually everything is fine, but if the persist file is only a couple hundred K, I will have to restore from the backup.

On 5/3/2016 at 2:28 PM, gamerscircle said:

I have a similar issue when I remove / delete debris via the tracking station.  I can deleted the debris, go back to KSC, but when I go back to the tracking.  All off icons [debris, probes, landers, etc.] are all 99 , but there isn't anything visible and I can't exit the tracking station.

If I check my persist file and the file since is around 5 mb,  then I know that I can restart the game and usually everything is fine, but if the persist file is only a couple hundred K, I will have to restore from the backup.

I have this exact issue. Except it happens randomly not just when i delete debris but also when changing ships. I even had it happen moments ago switching from a MUN lander back to the center, build a new ship, and lock up like this when i went to launch it. I could move the camera around and click all the buttons but nothing responded. Not even the ESC menu. This time it had nothing to do with the tracking station.  

 

My Mod list is extensive but i don't use remote tech or TAC Here is the list in case someone sees a problematic one i missed.

 

Astro/Cosmonauts for Texture Replacer (Astro-Cosmonauts 0.1)

Surprisingly i have actually had very little issues with KSP up until 1.1.2 even with the mass amount of mods. so i'm not sure what log file i should upload if someone could tell me what file it is.

 

Thanks
Symptoms sound suspiciously like those in this other thread.  Related, perhaps?
